intro: Deyeuxia abnormis, commonly known as the abnormal sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to parts of East Asia. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green or brown. It is characterized by its robust growth and ability to thrive in moist conditions. Deyeuxia abnormis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
